intro: Psychotria ivakoanyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
